page.title: 06SHEEP FARMING,ST.ALLEN AREA.
page.content: Treworgan is a 245 acre farm with a flock of 415 Suffolk,Border Leicester & Devon Longwool sheep & a few cattle; wheat & barley are grown for sale & animal food.The farmer employs 1 full- time worker who lives in a bungalow at the farm;they do all work including shearing.Efficient modern buildings are used for storage & animal housing. Ewes are brought to the lambing-sheds for controlled feeding 2 weeks before lambing & return to fields a day after lambing:this reduces incidence of disease in lambs.Lambing starts about December 1st.& lasts 1 month.Enough ewe-lambs are kept for replacement, plus a few ram-lambs;most are sold_ approx.360 this year_to wholesalers in Exeter.A lamb of minimum 85/90lbs. live-weight, 40/44lbs.dead-weight, fetches Â£58 at Easter,reducing to Â£28 by October.
